text: (Btw <!channel> we might be in need of a vacuum cleaner on Monday, someone might have one available? Don't think we require a industrial one, since most of the dusk is already gone
Okay cool !

<@UBM6QM2BX> <@UBE37B8JX> <@UC46W9E77> <@UBNQTDJ7R> please put below when you would be available to help and I will finalize the schedule for the first bit of next week

We have been making massive steps guys, good work so far :tada:
About next week, this was the planning so far:

Monday 17th
Put floor in big room ( Loek + James?)
Clean ceiling small room and potentially big room too (Kelly)
Finish painting in big room if necessary (1 free spots)
Finish painting in small room (1 รก 2 free spots)

Tuesday

Wednesday 19th
Put floor in small room (Loek + James?)
Paint protection layer on floor big room (1 free spot)

Thursday 20th
Paint protection layer on floor small room (Kelly)

Requirements: <@U0D6EPESC> you will bring a measurement role + houtvijl and furthermore buy and bring glue and a decoupeerzaag. As you can see there are quite some options for the saw, my suggestion would be to ask for some advice at Praxis, same goes for the glue, they prolly know which one to get (<https://www.praxis.nl/voordemakers/zoeken?term=decoupeerzaag>). Oh, and if you're on it, they might know which protection layer we need for the wood as well.

When Anish and I were in the office earlier, a lady called Ashley from the reception said that on the day of the roller disco there's a general opening in the offices during the day, and each company can host little workshops or introductions in their offices. We said we'd pass her email on to you <@U0D6EPESC> and <@U8AM0S37E>? The email is <mailto:ashley@dekroonrotterdam.nl|ashley@dekroonrotterdam.nl>
let me know otherwise i'll put it for sale next week
I also have a small couch at home that I don't use anymore. Do we need it?

Good catch <@U177W7XH8>! I think office chairs are our biggest concern right now, so if we could score some... anything else that is nice, is also more than welcome offcourse :wink: <!channel> who is willing to inform a bit tomorrow? Unfortunately, I am in Utrecht... but it's probably good to catch'm all before the masses come on Sat

Apparently they have a lot of stuff that they need to get rid off: <https://www.facebook.com/events/1535472816554996/>
Maybe we can get some useful stuff?
:ok_hand::skin-tone-2:
Correction: Friday morning - Sander and <@UC46W9E77> :car:
Thats it for now, good luck tomorrow, if you need anything, lemme know
<@U8AM0S37E> and <@UBNQTDJ7R> I will join you with your kick-off to give you the right instructions

I think that will be plenty for you those couple of hours <@UC46W9E77> <@UBM6QM2BX>. Oh, and in regards to what I said about the beams in the small room before, dont touch them, <@U0D6EPESC> and I will discuss tomorrow what to do with them

<@UC46W9E77> <@UBM6QM2BX> about your activities in the morning; Natalie and I made sure all the walls were clean, so you don't need to do that any more. What now the first thing for you to do is check if all the holes are filling in the walls in the big room (don't do the ceiling at all, its not needed). If filling is needed, use the tube called "muurvulling" (tip from a friend: I always use my fingers to apply it). For the holes and bits that have been filled, grab a piece of fine (not the rough) sandpaper and try to send down the restored part a bit to make it more blending with the wall and remove bigger bits. If already filled holes need more filling, do so. Once all that is done, make sure that all the high bits of the walls are cleaned (Natalie couldn't reach for those). After that. move on to the smaller room, Use fine sanding paper to sand down the loose flakes on the ceiling (you can already see bits that I have done). Then also start filling up holes in the walls and make sure that all the dirt is put in bags, etc
One note in general, we need to make sure that the door in between the rooms is from now on always closed to prevent dusk from the small room going into the big room where people are paiting

Friday morning - Sander (Taking our garbage and potentially carpet)
Friday afternoon - (Sander) Kelly and Natalie (Painting big room + potentially small room)

First of all, the planning:
Thursday morning - James and Anish (painting preperation and last work in small room)
Thursday afternoon - Kelly and Rahul (painting big room)
